page.title: 12 NOTCUTTS NURSERY WOODBRIDGE
page.content: Notcutts is a horticultural centre. The main branch is based in Woodbridge. There are 8 other branches in England: at Ardleigh, St Albans, Birmingham, Norwich, Peterborough, Maidstone, Bagshot and Oxford. Notcutts sell their plants, shrubs etc. throughout the United Kingdom and overseas. Notcutts in Woodbridge own 540 acres of land. The Woodbridge branch has been open since 1749 and was first known as{ Woods} but became known as {Notcutts} in 1897. Roughly 500 people are employed at the moment. Of these 320 are men and 180 are women. The jobs include part- time and Saturday work of various degrees of skill. Employees work 37-40 hours in a full time job. It is possible that in the near future mechanisation may replace some of the manual jobs.
